location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 14: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell refers to his earlier despatch, no. 403, dated 27 December 1849, which reported on the state of affairs in Bushire. This letter continues to report on affairs in Bushire. Hennell states that since the arrival at Bushire of Moollah Ahmed, the Moollah Bashee, confidence has been restored to the mercantile community. Hennell reports that the Moollah Bashee has called upon Bakir Khan to give back the fort of Chakoota; Bakir Khan has refused to do so, on the grounds that on taking the fort, he was only acting under the orders of the Nazim ul Mulk. Other details include speculation that the Chief of Dashtee [Khormoj, Iran] is contemplating attacking Bakir Khan.
